thread.title: 'Game of Thrones' Season 7 Premiere Date Revealed: Find Out When Winter Is Coming!
thread.title_full: 'Game of Thrones' Season 7 Premiere Date Revealed: Find Out When Winter Is Coming!

title: 'Game of Thrones' Season 7 Premiere Date Revealed: Find Out When Winter Is Coming!
text:
'Game of Thrones' Season 7 Premiere Date Revealed: Find Out When Winter Is Coming! March 9, 2017 @ 3:35 PM By Kat Rosenfield 
The last time we checked in with HBO's Game of Thrones , things were really heating up (except where they were cooling down, because, y'know, winter). The Battle of the Bastards was over, the Starks were back at Winterfell, Cersei Lannister ( Lena Headey ) had just firebombed a church and the white ravens were departing from the Citadel to herald the arrival of winter in the Seven Kingdoms. But until Thursday, March 9, it was a mystery as to when winter would come back â€” to our TV screens, in the form of the season 7 premiere. 10 Most Devastating TV Deaths of 2016 
Those of us not in Westeros tuned in for HBO's Facebook Live presentation on March 9 for the announcement of the long-awaited premiere date. Unfortunately for antsy fans, the big reveal took more than an hour, thanks to the marketing team's decision to encase the information in a giant block of ice, which clearly did not melt away as quickly as hoped. Game of Thrones Cast: What They Look Like Off-Screen! Lena Headey as Cersei Lannister courtesy of HBO 
After much ado, the news was out: Game of Thrones will return on July 16, 2017. (The series is set to end with season 8 , although talk persists of a possible spinoff .) You May Also Like
